text.p: Eurotunnel said it had appointed Richard Shirrefs as finance director effective November 1.
It said Michael Grant, group treasurer based in London, would continue to manage Eurotunnel's negotiations with the Steering Group representing its banking syndicate.

Eurotunnel said in a statement that Shirrefs would be based in Calais and be responsible to group managing director Georges-Christian Chazot for all finance-related functions in Eurotunnel's business.

Eurotunnel said Grant would report to Patrick Ponsolle, co-chairman and chairman of the group's executive committee, until the process of reaching any agreement with the steering group and gaining syndicate and shareholder approvals was done.
After that, sometime in 1997, the treasury and finance functions would be integrated, the group said.
Shirrefs is currently finance director of Tesco's French subsidiary Catteau.
